Source: Trademe.co.nz rentals, Numbeo Auckland CoL data, AT HOP transport costs
Notes: Single room in shared flat (3-4 people), outer suburbs (Mt Eden, Mt Albert, Panmure). Utilities: power, internet share. AT HOP monthly pass for zones 1-2. Basic groceries from Pak'nSave. No private healthcare - rely on public system + employer coverage. Minimal entertainment.

Source: Trademe.co.nz rentals, Numbeo Auckland CoL data
Notes: 1-bedroom apartment in outer areas (Henderson, Papatoetoe, Manukau). Full utilities. Public transport. Mix of Countdown/Pak'nSave groceries. Occasional dining out (2-3x/month). Basic contents insurance. GP visits as needed.

2-3 bedroom house/apartment, outer suburbs (Manurewa, Flat Bush, Albany). Public schools (free). Family groceries. Occasional family dining. Public healthcare + Southern Cross basic plan for family. Minimal entertainment budget.

Better room in good shared house, closer suburbs (Grey Lynn, Sandringham, Ellerslie). Full internet/utilities. Mix of public transport + occasional Uber. Brand-name groceries from Countdown. Regular dining/socializing. Basic gym membership.

Modern 1-bedroom apartment, mid-range suburbs (Newmarket, Parnell, Ponsonby fringe). Car ownership possible or frequent rideshare. Regular groceries from New World/Countdown. Dining out 6-8x/month. Southern Cross Wellbeing One insurance. Gym, entertainment, hobbies.

3-bedroom house, good school zones (Remuera, Epsom fringe, Birkenhead). Public schools (donation ~NZ$300/year not monthly). Family car. Regular family groceries New World. Family dining/activities. Southern Cross family plan. Kids activities, family entertainment.

Premium room in top-location shared house (Ponsonby, Herne Bay, Mission Bay). All utilities, fast internet. Own car or premium rideshare. Organic/premium groceries. Frequent dining at nice restaurants. Private health insurance. Gym membership, regular entertainment, travel.

Source: Trademe.co.nz luxury apartments, premium lifestyle costs
Notes: Modern apartment in premium locations (Viaduct, Wynyard Quarter, Parnell). Car ownership or premium transport. Farro Fresh/organic groceries. Frequent fine dining. Comprehensive Southern Cross insurance. Gym, hobbies, concerts, weekend getaways.

Notes: 4-bedroom house in top suburbs (Remuera, Herne Bay, St Heliers). Private international school: ACG Parnell/Strathallan (NZ$25,000/year = NZ$2,083/month per child). Family car. Premium groceries. Regular fine dining. Comprehensive private healthcare. Extensive extracurriculars, family travel, premium entertainment.
